Abajo voy a pegarles una descripci=F3n que hizo un programador de VJ's 
de =
la industria en USA, est=E1 en ingl=E9s, perd=F3n si alguno no lo 
entiende=
.
Yo le pregunt=E9 que tal era trabajar en esa industria (porque ahora ya 
=
no lo hace) y =E9sto es lo que me contest=F3:

Well, to answer your questio=
n=85. I studied Computer Science with a 
focus in game development and grap=
hics all through college and worked 
at (nombre de la coma=F1=EDa) which wa=
s fun.  When I began working on 
Advergames it was great!  I loved the envi=
ronment and the people I 
worked with in the industry.  The game industry e=
ncourages the use of 
creativity and your artistic abilities which is aweso=
me.  However, 
everyone wants to get into the game industry so it has cause=
d a flood 
of programmers wanting to work.  This has caused problems with t=
he 
companies treating their employees with the compensations they 
deserve=
 and very little benefits.  If you enjoy programming graphics 
and a fun, e=
xciting environment and low pay, the game industry is 
great.  But it's har=
d to enjoy your work when you aren't getting paid 
enough to live on.  This=
 disappointed me because I focused on it so 
much in college.  However, it =
allowed me to utilize most of my 
programming skills in sound, memory manag=
ement, graphics, 
optimization, networking, etc=85.

Another point to think=
 about is most game development companies are 
small which limits the abili=
ty to move up and around in a company.  I 
worked at (nombre de la compa=F1=
=EDa) for two years and received only one 
raise of $0.50 an hour and no bo=
nuses.  I was rated one of the better 
and more experienced programmers so =
it really sucked. Also, there was 
no chance of me moving into a better pos=
ition with more 
responsibility other than a coder.

Overall, it is a caree=
r I would definitely go back to but only if I 
didn't have to worry about m=
y financial future.  That is the only 
reason I am not working in games.


=
Espero que sirva de alg=FAn modo.
